titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Alexandre Georgievich Tarsaidze papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Olga Verhovskoy Dunlop

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-05-12T16:12-0700

change.item: Added motion picture film access copy information (Vishnu Jani).
Added 16mm to films, corrected material names to "Motion Picture Film."
Revised to update encoding and add unitid.
Added information about reformatted sound recordings.

PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Alexandre Georgievich Tarsaidze Papers)//EN" "reg_185.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

physdesc.extent: 30 manuscript boxes, 7 oversize boxes, 39 envelopes, 1 album box, 11 motion picture film reels, 5 sound discs

did.abstract: Correspondence, speeches and writings, research notes, printed matter, photographs, engravings, lithographs, maps, and sound and video recordings relating to the history of Georgia (Transcaucasia), the Romanov family, Russian-American relations, and the Association of Russian Imperial Naval Officers in America. Includes photocopies of Romanov family letters, photographs of Russia during World War I by Donald C. Thompson, and a documentary film of Tsar Nicholas II.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Use copies of some motion picture film and all sound recordings in this collection are available for immediate access. To view other films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Alexandre Georgievich Tarsaidze papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1978.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Born, Tiflis, Russia, into family of old Georgian nobility
Worked with Allied High Commissioner, Col. W. Haskell, in Tiflis

eventgrp.event: Worked for Matchabelli Perfumes, R. H. Macy Co., Parfum Chevalier Garde, and other retailers in cosmetic and jewelry business
Member, Association of Former Russian Imperial Naval Officers
Member, Georgian Society in the U.S.A.

chronitem.event: Author, Morskoi Korpus za CHetvert' Veka, 1901-1925, N.Y.
Director of Public Relations, Serge Obolensky Associates

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, speeches and writings, research notes, printed matter, photographs, engravings, lithographs, maps, and sound and video recordings relating to the history of Georgia (Transcaucasia), the Romanov family, Russian-American relations, and the Association of Russian Imperial Naval Officers in America. Includes photocopies of Romanov family letters, photographs of Russia during World War I by Donald C. Thompson, and a documentary film of Tsar Nicholas II.

controlaccess.corpname: Association of Russian Imperial Naval Officers in America
controlaccess.subject: Russians--United States.
World War, 1914-1918--Russia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, genealogical material, family papers and miscellaneous printed matter relating to the life, writings, and social activities of Alexandre Tarsaidze and the Eristov family, arranged alphabetically by physical form.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Russian-American and other social events, especially charity.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes file on Panama Canal Treaty.

Documents relating to lawsuit against Martini & Rossi Corp.,

scopecontent.p: Books, articles, letters to the editor, and incidental writings of Alexandre Tarsaidze, arranged chronologically and by alphabetically by title thereunder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence and printed matter relating to the Caucasus, Transcaucasus, and Russia. Includes material about the Imperial Russian Army, Navy, and Air Force, especially in World War I. Also includes material related to the Russian Imperial family and especially the film Emperor Nicholas II, Last Czar of Russia produced by A. Tarsaidze. Arranged alphabetically by subject.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Printed matter, including prints, posters, chromolithographs, books, and albums of Caucasians in national dress; Georgian royalty, nobility, and national monuments; Russian tsars and emperors, Russian nobility, Russian Imperial Army and Navy; and miscellany related to St. Petersburg. Arranged alphabetically by subject.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 404 prints, 51 postcards, 40 duplicates, 2 color transparencies, and 2 albums. Includes photographs of the Tarsaidze family; the Russian Imperial Army and Navy; World War I, the Revolution of 1917, and the Russian Civil War; Emperor Nicholas II, the Imperial family, and the Romanov family; and Georgia and the Transcaucasus. Arranged by subject.

did.unittitle: 8 prints and 12 duplicates depicting A. Tarsaidze,
24 prints depicting the Tarsaidze and Eristavi families,
5 prints depicting Russian Imperial Air Force,
